snippet: The bill that won final approval in the Senate left behind what might have been the best chance the Obama administration had to meet its obligations to the world’s other economic powers.
abstract: Senate gives final approval to $1.1 trillion spending bill for current fiscal year, leaving behind what might have been Obama administration's best chance to overhaul International Monetary Fund and meet its obligations to world's other economic powers.
lead_paragraph: The bill that won final approval in the Senate left behind what might have been the best chance the Obama administration had to meet its obligations to the world’s other economic powers.

headline.main: Spending Plan Ignores Overhaul for I.M.F.
headline.print_headline: Spending Plan Ignores Overhaul for the International Monetary Fund
